thread.title: Miami football must fire Al Golden—no more excuses - College Football
thread.title_full: Miami football must fire Al Golden—no more excuses - College Football - SI.com

author: Andy Staples
title: Miami football must fire Al Golden—no more excuses - College Football
text:
by Andy Staples Twitter Email Posted: Sat Oct. 24, 2015 MIAMI GARDENS, Fla. — There are no excuses big enough to excuse what Al Golden’s Miami team did Saturday. The Hurricanes lost 58–0 to Clemson , passing a 1944 loss to Texas A&M for the most lopsided defeat in school history. They trailed by 42 at halftime. They looked lifeless and outclassed against a team at the level they aspire to reach. But Saturday offered definitive proof that Miami will never get there under Golden—no matter how many excuses anyone makes.
The crowd was lame.
Did you see that weather? Who could blame them for going to the beach instead of watching what the Hurricanes have put on the field the past few years? Miami plays seven games a year at Sun Life Stadium. If the administration wanted to, it could tarp off the entire upper deck and make every game feel full.
College Football Instant Analysis: Clemson clobbers Miami 58–0; time for Al Golden to go by Andy Staples
